RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
I got the Master Degree in Physics in 2002 by writing a thesis in the field of Theoretical Quantum Optics. In 2006 I got the Ph.D. in Physics, at University of Salerno, by defending a thesis on Ultracold Atoms in Optical Lattices by focusing my efforts on Quantum Phase Transitions and Statistical Mechanics. The Ph.D. thesis collected some of the results on ultracold bosons in one-dimensional optical lattices I achieved by employing the Bose-Hubbard models and statistical mechanics concepts as theoretical tools. After four months in Salerno, where I was working (as Research Collaborator) on Bose-Fermi mixtures in periodic geometries, I moved in Germany. Here I have spent one year as Post-Doc at University of Hannover by facing with dipolar bosons in one- and two-dimensional optical lattices. This was the topic of my research during the four months at University of Catania as well. Finally, I have worked for eight years at University of Padova as Post-Doctoral Fellow. I have focused on Trapped Ultracold Atoms from a theoretical point of view by addressing problems both in the framework of the Hubbard models [(dipolar) bosons in double-, triple- ,and four-well potentials] and in the framework of the Gross-Pitaevskii equations. I have performed such studies both analytically (mean-field approximation, time-independent theory of perturbations) and numerically (codes written in Fortran and in Mathematica to solve partial differential equations and to find the eigenvectors and eigenvalues of Hamiltonian operators). I have dedicated an important part of my activity to the links between superconductive junctions and their atomic counterpart in the presence of bosonic atoms and to the role played by the quantum information concepts (mainly the entanglement entropy) in the trapped ultracold atoms context. In the last part of my staying in Padova, I have dedicated my efforts to systems deriving from the combination of double-well-confined bosons and optical resonators to study the effects of the cavity field on the dynamics of bosonic Josephon junctions. At University of Padova, I have taught both for undergraduate (Mechanics, Thermodynamics, and Electromagnetism) and Physics PhD students (for them I have given a cycle of lectures entitled ?Introduction to Quantum Information?). During the period spent in Padova I have been co-supervisor for four B.Sc and two Master Degree students. I have proposed a research project that has guaranteed to me funds for one of my Post-Doctoral Fellowships (2012-2014) and I have been co-proponent of three financed projects to get funds for research.
Skills and Expertise: Bose-Einstein Condensates, Ultracold Quantum Gases, Quantum Optics, Theoretical Condensed Matter Physics, Quantum Phase Transitions, Optical Lattices, Quantum Information, Coherent States.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: doctorate at Trapped Ultracold Bosons;Quantum Phase Transitions from Universit degli Studi di Salerno (2006). Has experience in Physics

Casati [total grant: 968.1 kEuro]. PRIN project Padova research team: F. Toigo (local coordinator), L. Salasnich, P.A. Marchetti, L. Dell'Anna, and G. Mazzarella. Financed by Ministero Istruzione Universit e Ricerca (MIUR)
